security: Releasing this document could highlight the CIA's interaction with the FBI and their monitoring of individuals, potentially raising concerns about domestic surveillance and the extent of inter-agency cooperation on matters related to internal security. The document states: 'This Directorate does not maintain a file on Subject. A search of the records of this Directorate revealed one FBI report as follows, which mentions Subject'.
summary: A memorandum stating that the CIA's Directorate of Operations (DDO) does not maintain a file on Edwin Anderson Walker, but a search revealed an FBI report mentioning him.
summary_one_paragraph: On August 5, 1976, Frederick C. Randall, Chief of the DDO/Privacy and Information Coordinator, sent a memorandum to the Chief of the Information and Privacy Staff, indicating that the DDO does not maintain a file on Edwin Anderson Walker. However, a search did reveal one FBI report from Boston, dated December 6, 1972, concerning 'Boston Scientists and Engineers for Social and Political Action (SESPA) Internal Security-REVACT,' which mentions Walker.
tags: Boston Scientists and Engineers for Social and Political Action (SESPA)
title: Edwin Anderson Walker
sender: Frederick C. Randall (Chief, DDO/Privacy and Information Coordinator)
